answer: <p>Both kinds of enclosed characters are strings.  One type of quote is conveniently used to enclose the other type of quote.  <code>"'"</code>  and <code>'"'</code>.   The biggest difference between the types of quotes is that enclosed identifier references are substituted for inside double quotes, but not inside single quotes.</p>
data.title: What is the difference between single-quoted and double-quoted strings in PHP?
data.content:
<p>I'm a little confused why I see some code in PHP with string placed in single quotes and sometimes in double quotes.</p>

<p>I just know in .NET, or the C language, if it is in a single quote, that means it is a character, not a string.</p>
